verses.verse: And Moses<WH4872> spoke<WH1696> unto the heads<WH7218> of the tribes<WH4294> concerning the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, This is the thing<WH1697> which the Lord<WH3068> has commanded<WH6680>.

If a man<WH376> vow<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto the Lord<WH3068>, or swear<WH7650> an oath<WH7621> to bind<WH631> his soul<WH5315> with a bond<WH632>; he shall not break<WH2490> his word<WH1697>, he shall do<WH6213> according to all that proceeds<WH3318> out of his mouth<WH6310>.
If a woman<WH802> also vow<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto the Lord<WH3068>, and bind<WH631> herself by a bond<WH632>, being in her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> in her youth<WH5271>;

And her father<WH1> hear<WH8085> her vow<WH5088>, and her bond<WH632> with which she has bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>, and her father<WH1> shall hold his peace<WH2790> at her<WH5088>: then all her vows shall stand<WH6965>, and every bond<WH632> with which she has bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> shall stand<WH6965>.

But if her father<WH1> disallow<WH5106> her in the day<WH3117> that he hears<WH8085>; not any of her vows<WH5088>, or of her bonds<WH632> with which she has bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>, shall stand<WH6965>: and the Lord<WH3068> shall forgive<WH5545> her<WH1>, because her father disallowed her<WH5106>.
And if she had at all an husband<WH376>, when she vowed<WH5088>, or uttered<WH4008> ought out of her lips<WH8193>, with which she bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>;

And her husband<WH376> heard<WH8085> it<WH2790>, and held his peace at her in the day<WH3117> that he heard<WH8085> it<WH5088>: then her vows shall stand<WH6965>, and her bonds<WH632> with which she bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> shall stand<WH6965>.

But if her husband<WH376> disallowed<WH5106> her on the day<WH3117> that he heard<WH8085> it<WH5088>; then he shall make her vow which she vowed, and that which she uttered<WH4008> with her lips<WH8193>, with which she bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315>, of none effect<WH6565>: and the Lord<WH3068> shall forgive her<WH5545>.
But every vow<WH5088> of a widow<WH490>, and of her that is divorced<WH1644>, with which they have bound<WH631> their souls<WH5315>, shall stand against her<WH6965>.
And if she vowed<WH5087> in her husband<WH376>'s house<WH1004>, or bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> by a bond<WH632> with an oath<WH7621>;

And her husband<WH376> heard<WH8085> it<WH2790>, and held his peace at her<WH5106>, and disallowed her not<WH5088>: then all her vows shall stand<WH6965>, and every bond<WH632> with which she bound<WH631> her soul<WH5315> shall stand<WH6965>.

But if her husband<WH376> has utterly<WH6565> made them void<WH6565> on the day<WH3117> he heard<WH8085> them<WH4161>; then whatever proceeded out of her lips<WH8193> concerning her vows<WH5088>, or concerning the bond<WH632> of her soul<WH5315>, shall not stand<WH6965>: her husband<WH376> has made them void<WH6565>; and the Lord<WH3068> shall forgive her<WH5545>.
Every vow<WH5088>, and every binding<WH632> oath<WH7621> to afflict<WH6031> the soul<WH5315>, her husband<WH376> may establish<WH6965> it<WH376>, or her husband may make it void<WH6565>.

But if her husband<WH376> altogether<WH2790> hold his peace<WH2790> at her from day<WH3117> to day<WH3117>; then he establishes<WH6965> all her vows<WH5088>, or all her bonds<WH632>, which are upon her<WH6965>: he confirms them<WH2790>, because he held his peace at her in the day<WH3117> that he heard them<WH8085>.
But if he shall any ways<WH6565> make them void<WH6565> after<WH310> that he has heard<WH8085> them<WH5375>; then he shall carry her iniquity<WH5771>.

These are the statutes<WH2706>, which the Lord<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872>, between a man<WH376> and his wife<WH802>, between the father<WH1> and his daughter<WH1323>, being yet in her youth<WH5271> in her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>.
